#### Aside

- C++ is difficult because there are so many ways to do things
  - Standard Library:
    - [STL](https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/header)
    - [STL Algorithms](https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/algorithm)
    - [STL Containers](https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/container)
    - Other Third Party Libraries like [Boost](https://www.boost.org/)
  - Build Systems:
    - [CMake](https://cmake.org/features/)
    - [Make](https://www.gnu.org/software/make/)
    - [Bazel](https://bazel.build/)
    - [Meson](https://mesonbuild.com/)
    - [Ninja](https://ninja-build.org/)
    - [Spack](https://spack.io/)
  - Testing Libraries
    - [Google Test](https://github.com/google/googletest)
    - [DocTest](https://github.com/doctest/doctest)
    - [Catch2](https://github.com/catchorg/Catch2)
    - [CTest](https://cmake.org/cmake/help/latest/manual/ctest.1.html)
  - Benchmarking libraries
    - [Google Benchmark](https://github.com/google/benchmark)
    - [NanoBench](https://nanobench.ankerl.com/)
  - Profiling / debugging tools
    - [Valgrind](http://valgrind.org/)
    - [GDB](https://www.gnu.org/software/gdb/)
    - [LLDB](https://lldb.llvm.org/)
    - [Intel VTune](https://software.intel.com/content/www/us/en/develop/tools/oneapi/components/vtune-profiler.html)
  - Documentation Generators:
    - [Doxygen](https://www.doxygen.nl/index.html)
    - [Sphinx](https://www.sphinx-doc.org/en/master/)
  - Compiler variations:
    - [GNU C Compiler](https://gcc.gnu.org/)
    - [Clang](https://clang.llvm.org/)
    - [Visual Studio](https://visualstudio.microsoft.com/)
    - [Intel C++ Compiler](https://software.intel.com/content/www/us/en/develop/tools/oneapi/components/compiler.html)
  - IDEs:
    - [Visual Studio Code](https://code.visualstudio.com/)
    - [CLion](https://www.jetbrains.com/clion/)
    - [Eclipse](https://www.eclipse.org/)
